paper_abstract: Using the AutoGraphiX 2 system (AGX2), we study further relations between graph invariants of the form lb(n) <= R circle plus i <= ub(n) where R denotes the Randic index of a graph G = (V, E), i another invariant, E) denotes one of the four operations +, -, x, /, lb(n), and ub(n) lower and upper bounding functions of the order n of the graph considered which are tight for all n (except possibly very small values due to border effects). Here i is in turn maximum, minimum and average degree, Delta, delta and (d) over bar, diameter D, girth g, algebraic and node connectivity, a and v, Conjectures are obtained in 51 out of 56 cases, 28 of which are proved automatically, 19 are proved by hand, 7 remain open and only one is refuted.
paper_title: Variable neighborhood search for extremal graphs. 19. Further conjectures and results about the Randic index
